Let him, however, not mind that, for he whom he thus knows, is pointed out by himself. translated: They said to Pragâpati, 'What has become of that which was ours?' He said, 'That which was of you has gone down (into the water).' They said, 'What has become of that which was ours?' He said, 'That which was of you has gone down (into the water).'

analyzed: eva etat samārohan tāḥ u eva etat yajamānaḥ dviṣataḥ bhrātṛvyasya vṛṅkte tha u tā
translated: the gods then wrested them from the Asuras. Then they mounted them. In the same way the sacrificer now wrests them from his hateful enemy. Then he🔽mounts them.

analyzed: eva etat samārohati atha u etat vai etābhiḥ devāḥ ā atas
translated: he mounts upon that. Or, by means of these (verses) the gods went from here to yonder world,

analyzed: samprāpnuvan tathā eva ābhiḥ ayam etat ā atas samprāpnoti
translated: he mounts upon that. And, indeed, by means of these (bricks) the gods then reached this (world); and in like manner does this (Sacrificer) thereby reach this (world).

analyzed: atha aśmānam pṛśnim upadadhāti  asau vai ādityaḥ śmā
translated: He then lays down the variegated stone.🔽The variegated stone is yonder sun;

original: pṛśniramumevaitadādityamupadadhāti pṛśnirbhavati raśmibhirhi maṇḍalam pṛśni🔽tamantareṇāhavanīyaṃ ca gārhapatyaṃ copadadhātyayaṃ vai loko gārhapatyo
analyzed: pṛśniḥ amum eva etat ādityam upadadhāti pṛśniḥ bhavati raśmibhiḥ hi maṇḍalam pṛśni  tam antareṇa āhavanīyam ca gārhapatyam ca upadadhāti ayam vai lokaḥ gārhapatyaḥ
translated: he thus lays down yonder sun. It is variegated, for the disk (of the sun) is variegated with its rays.

original: dyaurāhavanīya etaṃ tadimau lokāvantareṇa dadhāti tasmādeṣa imau lokāvantareṇa🔽tapati / / /
analyzed: dyauḥ āhavanīyaḥ etam tat imau lokau antareṇa dadhāti tasmāt eṣaḥ imau lokau antareṇa  tapati
translated: He lays it down between the Âhavanîya and the Gârhapatya. The Gârhapatya is this (terrestrial) world, and the Âhavanîya is the sky: he thus places it between these two worlds, whence it (the sun) shines between these two worlds.

original: āgnīdhravelāyām /🔽antarikṣaṃ vā āgnīdhrametaṃ tadantarikṣe dadhāti tasmādeṣo
analyzed: āgnīdhra velāyām  antarikṣam vai āgnīdhram etam tat antarikṣe dadhāti tasmāt eṣaḥ
translated: He lays it down on the line of the Âgnîdhrîya.

analyzed: ntarikṣa āyatanaḥ vyadhve vyadhve hi eṣaḥ itas
translated: The Âgnîdhrîya is the air: he thus places it in the air, whence it (the sun) has the air for its abode. On the cross-line (he lays it down): for from here it (the sun) is on the cross-line.

analyzed: saḥ eṣa prāṇaḥ  prāṇam eva etat ātman dhatte tat etat āyuḥ āyuḥ eva etat ātman dhatte
translated: It is the breath,🔽he thus puts breath into his (the Sacrificer's) self. It is life: he thus puts life into his self.

original: tadetadannamāyurhyetadannamu vā āyuraśmā bhavati sthiro vā aśmā sthiraṃ tadāyuḥ
analyzed: tat etat annam āyuḥ hi etat annam u vai āyuḥ aśmā bhavati sthiraḥ vai aśmā sthiram tat āyuḥ
translated: It is food, for it is food that is life. It is a stone, for a stone is firm: he thus makes life firm.

analyzed: kurute pṛśniḥ bhavati pṛśni iva hi annam  saḥ upadadhāti
translated: He makes it variegated; for food is variegated.

original: vimāna eṣa divo madhya āsta iti vimāno hyeṣa divo madhya āsta🔽āpaprivānrodasī antarikṣamityudyanvā eṣa imāṃlokānāpūrayati sa viśvācīrabhicaṣṭe🔽ghṛtācīriti srucaścaitadvedīścāhāntarā pūrvamaparaṃ ca ketumityantaremaṃ ca
analyzed: vimānaḥ eṣa divaḥ madhye āste iti vimānaḥ hi eṣa divaḥ madhye āste  āpaprivān rodasī antarikṣam iti udyan vai eṣaḥ imān lokān āpūrayati sa viśvācīḥ abhicaṣṭe  ghṛtācīḥ iti srucaḥ ca etat vedīḥ ca āha antarā pūrvam aparam ca ketum iti antarā imam ca
translated: He lays it down, with , 'The measure, the heavenly,'--for this (altar) is indeed the measure, the heavenly;

original: lokamamuṃ cetyetadatho yaccedametarhi cīyate yaccādaḥ pūrvamacīyateti / / /🔽ukṣā samudro aruṇaḥ suparṇa iti /
analyzed: lokam amum ca iti etat atha u yat ca idam etarhi cīyate yat ca adaḥ pūrvam acīyata iti  ukṣā samudraḥ aruṇaḥ suparṇaḥ iti
translated: '--filling the two worlds, the atmosphere,'--for rising up he fills these worlds; 'he looks on all the bright,'--that is, the Sruva-spoons and the Vedi; 'the two ends between,'--that is, this world and yonder world; 'and what is now being built here, and what was built aforetime;'

analyzed: ukṣā hi eṣa samudraḥ ruṇaḥ suparṇaḥ pūrvasya
translated: '--the bull, the ocean, the red-winged bird,'--for he is indeed the bull, the ocean, the red-winged bird;

original: yonim piturāviveśeti pūrvasya hyeṣa etaṃ yonim piturāviśati madhye divo nihitaḥ
analyzed: yonim pituḥ āviveśa iti pūrvasya hi eṣaḥ etam yonim pituḥ āviśati madhye divaḥ nihitaḥ
translated: '--he hath entered the womb of the father of the former,'--for he indeed enters the womb of the father of the former; 'placed in the middle of the sky,'--

original: pṛśniraśmeti madhye hyeṣa divo nihitaḥ pṛśniraśmā vicakrame rajasaspātyantāviti
analyzed: pṛśni raśmā iti madhye hi eṣa divaḥ nihitaḥ pṛśni raśmā vicakrame rajasaspāti antau iti
translated: '--the variegated ray,'--for he is indeed placed in the middle of the sky, the variegated ray; 'he hath traversed the region, the supporter of the ends,'--

analyzed: vikramamāṇaḥ vai eṣaḥ eṣām lokānām antān yāti
translated: for he indeed traverses these worlds, and reaches their ends.

analyzed: dvābhyām upadadhāti
translated: With two (verses) he lays it down;--

analyzed: dvipād yajamānaḥ yajamānaḥ gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā
translated: The Sacrificer is two-footed; the Sacrificer is Agni. As great as Agni is, as great as is his measure,

original: tāvataivainametadupadadhāti triṣṭubbhyāṃ traiṣṭubho hyeṣa na sādayatyasannoy🔽hyeṣa na sūdadohasādhivadati prāṇo vai sūdadohāḥ prāṇa eṣa kim prāṇe prāṇaṃ
analyzed: tāvatā eva enam etat upadadhāti triṣṭubbhyām traiṣṭubhaḥ hi eṣa na sādayati a sanna uya  hi eṣa na sūdadohasā adhivadati prāṇaḥ vai sūdadohāḥ prāṇaḥ eṣa kim prāṇe prāṇam
translated: with so much he thus lays him down. With two Trishtubh (verses) (he lays him down); for he belongs to the Trishtubh. He does not settle him; for he is settled.

original: dadhyāmiti taṃ nidhāya yathā na naśyet / / /
analyzed: dadhyām iti tam nidhāya yathā na naśyet
translated: He does not utter the Sûdadohas over him; for the Sûdadohas is the breath, and he is the breath: 'What,' he thinks, 'if I were to put the breath into the breath?' Having laid him down (in the fire), (the Adhvaryu) moves away from him so as not to be burnt.

original: athopāyanti /🔽indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhanniti tasyokto bandhurdevahūryajña ā ca
analyzed: atha upāyanti  indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan iti tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ deva hūḥ yajñaḥ ā ca
translated: They then approach (the fire).

original: vakṣatsumnahūryajña ā ca vakṣaditi devahūścaiva yajñaḥ sumnahūśca
analyzed: vakṣat sumna hūḥ yajñaḥ ā ca vakṣat iti deva hūḥ ca eva yajñaḥ sumna hūḥ ca
translated: 'All (the gods) have exalted Indra,'--the meaning of this has been explained;--'the divine Yajna, may he carry (the offering) to the gods!'--Yajna, doubtless, is the divine one, and he indeed carries (the offering) to the gods.

original: yakṣadagnirdevo devāṃ ā ca vakṣaditi yakṣaccaivāgnirdevo devānā ca vahatvityetat / / /
analyzed: yakṣat agniḥ devaḥ devān ā ca vakṣat iti yakṣat ca eva agniḥ devaḥ devān ā ca vahatu iti etat
translated: 'The divine Agni, the bestower, may he carry the offering to the gods!'--the divine Agni is indeed the bestower, and he carries the offering to the gods: this is what he thereby says.

analyzed: vājasya mā prasavaḥ
translated: 'May the impulse of strength

original: udgrābheṇodagrabhīt adhā sapatnānindro me nigrābheṇādharā🔽akariti yathaiva yajustathā bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: udgrābheṇa udagrabhīt adha sapatnān indraḥ me nigrābheṇa adharā  akaḥ iti yathā eva yajuḥ tathā bandhuḥ
translated: Udgṛabhî (may he seize) with the uplifting (verse), and with Nigrâbhî (may he seize) the lower (enemies) for me!'--as the text, so the meaning.

analyzed: udgrābham ca nigrābham ca
translated: 'The uplifting and the seizing,

original: brahma devā avīvṛdhan adhā sapatnānindrāgnī me
analyzed: brahma devāḥ avīvṛdhan adha sapatnān indra agnī me
translated: Brahman hath exalted the gods; and with Nigrâbhî (may he seize) the lower (enemies) for me!'--the gods, doubtless, are these worlds, and Brahman is the sacrifice: thus, 'The sacrifice hath exalted the gods, and with Nigrâbhî (may he seize) the lower (enemies) for me!'

analyzed: viṣūcīn ānvyasyatām iti yathā eva yajuḥ tathā bandhuḥ
translated: 'Let them be woven crosswise', (with these words) he puts on the fourth; as the text, so the meaning.

analyzed: tat yāḥ amuṣmāt ādityāt ūrdhvāḥ catasraḥ diśaḥ
translated: Now those four quarters which are above yonder sun,

analyzed: tāḥ etat devāḥ asurāṇām avṛñjata atha u tāḥ
translated: those the gods then wrested from the Asuras; and then

original: evaitatsamārohaṃstā u evaitadyajamāno dviṣato bhrātṛvyasya vṛṅkte 'tho tā🔽evaitatsamārohatyatho etadvā etābhirdevā ātaḥ
analyzed: eva etat samārohan tāḥ u eva etat yajamānaḥ dviṣataḥ bhrātṛvyasya vṛṅkte tha u tā  eva etat samārohati atha u etat vai etābhiḥ devāḥ ā atas
translated: they mounted them; and in the same way does the Sacrificer thereby wrest them from his hateful enemy, and then

analyzed: samprāpnuvan tathā eva ābhiḥ ayam etat ā atas samprāpnoti
translated: mount them. And, moreover, by means of them the gods then reached yonder world; and in the same way does this (Sacrificer) thereby reach yonder world.

analyzed: atha agnim ārohanti
translated: They then ascend the fire-altar.

original: kramadhvamagninā nākamiti svargo vai loko nākaḥ🔽kramadhvamanenāgninaitaṃ svargaṃ lokamityetadukhyaṃ hasteṣu bibhrata🔽ityukhyaṃ hyeta etaṃ hasteṣu bibhrati divaspṛṣṭhaṃ svargatvā miśrā
analyzed: kramadhvam agninā nākam iti svargaḥ vai lokaḥ nākaḥ  kramadhvam anena agninā etam svargam lokam iti etat ukhyam hasteṣu bibhrata  iti ukhyam hi ete etam hasteṣu bibhrati diva spṛṣṭham svar ga tvā miśrā
translated: 'Mount ye the vault by Agni,'--the vault, doubtless, is the heavenly world;--

original: devebhirādhvamiti divaspṛṣṭhaṃ svargaṃ lokaṃ gatvā miśrā devebhirādhvamityetat / / /
analyzed: devebhiḥ ādhvam iti diva spṛṣṭham svargam lokam gatvā miśrāḥ devebhiḥ ādhvam iti etat
translated: 'mount ye by this Agni to that heavenly world,' this is what he says;--'bearing the smoke in your hands,'--for they bear that smoke in their hands;--'having gone to the back of the sky, mix ye with the gods,'--that is, 'having gone to the back of the sky, the heavenly world, mix ye with the gods.'

analyzed: prācīm anu pradiśam prehi vidvān iti
translated: 'Go forward, O wise one, along the eastern region!'

original: prācī vai digagneḥ svāmanu pradiśam prehi
analyzed: prācī vai diś agneḥ svām anu pradiśam prehi
translated: The eastern region, doubtless, belongs to Agni;--'go forward along that region of thine own!'

original: vidvānityetadagneragne puro agnirbhavehetyasya tvamagneragne puro🔽'gnirbhavehetyetadviśvā āśā dīdyāno vibhāhīti sarvā āśā dīpyamāno
analyzed: vidvān iti etat agneḥ agne puras agniḥ bhava iha iti asya tvam agneḥ agne puras  gniḥ bhava iha iti etat viśvāḥ āśāḥ dīdyānaḥ vibhāhi iti sarvāḥ āśāḥ dīpyamānaḥ
translated: 'The wise', this is of Agni; 'O Agni, be thou in front of the fire', this means 'be thou in front of this fire, O Agni'; 'shining, illumine all the regions', shining, illumine all the regions.

original: vibhāhītyetadūrjaṃ no dhehi dvipade catuṣpada ityāśiṣamāśāste / / /
analyzed: vibhāhi iti etat ūrjam naḥ dhehi dvipade catuṣpade iti āśiṣam āśāste
translated: The wise one, this is of Agni; O Agni, be thou in front of the fires, this is of the fire; O Agni, be thou in front of this fire, this is of the fire; Shining in all quarters, shine, this is Shining in all quarters, shine; Bestow strength upon our bipeds and quadrupeds, he prays for a blessing.

analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ aham  ud antarikṣam āruham antarikṣāt divam āruham iti  gārhapatyāt hi āgnīdhrīyam āgacanti āgnīdhrīyāt āhavanīyam divaḥ nākasya
translated: I from the earth.

analyzed: pṛṣṭhāt svar jyotiḥ agām aham iti divaḥ nākasya pṛṣṭhāt svargam lokam agām aham iti etat
translated: I have ascended from the earth to the atmosphere, from the atmosphere to the sky, thus he says; from the Gārhapatya he goes to the Āhavaniya, from the Āhavaniya to the sky, to the back of the vault, to the heavenly light, I have gone, from the back of the vault of the sky, to the heavenly world, I have gone, thus he says.

analyzed: svar yantaḥ na apekṣante
translated: Those who go to heaven do not look back.

original: ā dyāṃ rohanti rodasī iti na haiva te 'pekṣante ye svargaṃ🔽lokaṃ yanti yajñaṃ ye viśvatodhāraṃ suvidvāṃso vitenira ityeṣa eva yajño
analyzed: ā dyām rohanti rodasī iti na ha eva te pekṣante ye svargam  lokam yanti yajñam ye viśvatas dhāram su vidvāṃsaḥ vitenire iti eṣaḥ eva yajñaḥ
translated: They ascend the sky, the two worlds, they do not look back, indeed, those who go to the heavenly world.

original: viśvatodhāra eta u eva suvidvāṃso ya etaṃ vitanvate / / /🔽agne prehi prathamo devayatāmiti /
analyzed: viśvatodhāraḥ ete u eva su vidvāṃsaḥ ye etam vitanvate  agne prehi prathamaḥ devayatām iti
translated: The sacrifice which has all the streams, the wise ones who spread it out, this very sacrifice has all the streams, and they are indeed the wise ones who spread it out.

analyzed: imam etat agnim āha tvam eṣām prehi prathamaḥ
translated: O Agni, go in front of those who worship the gods, this is of Agni; go in front of these, this is of this (sacrificer); with the gods, O god, to the gods, this is of the gods.

original: devayatāmiti cakṣurdevānāmuta martyānāmityubhayeṣāṃ haitaddevamanuṣyāṇāṃ🔽cakṣuriyakṣamāṇā bhṛgubhiḥ sajoṣā iti yajamānā bhṛgubhiḥ sajoṣā ityetatsvaryantu
analyzed: devayatām iti cakṣuḥ devānām uta martyānām iti ubhayeṣām ha etat deva manuṣyāṇām  cakṣuḥ iyakṣamāṇāḥ bhṛgubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ iti yajamānāḥ bhṛgubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ iti etat svar yantu
translated: 'To the gods who go to the gods', (with the words), 'the eye of the gods and of men', (he offers) for the eye of both, of the gods and men.

original: yajamānāḥ svastīti svargaṃ lokaṃ yantu yajamānāḥ svastītyetat / / /
analyzed: yajamānāḥ svasti iti svargam lokam yantu yajamānāḥ svasti iti etat
translated: 'The sacrificers, in unison with the Bhrigus, seeking', (with the words), 'the sacrificers, in unison with the Bhrigus, seeking', he says this. 'May the sacrificers go to heaven in safety', (with the words), 'may the sacrificers go to heaven in safety', he says this.

original: tadyā amuṣmiṃloke pañca diśaḥ /🔽tā etaddevā asurāṇāmavṛñjatātho tā
analyzed: tat yāḥ amuṣmin loke pañca diśaḥ  tāḥ etat devāḥ asurāṇām avṛñjata atha u tāḥ
translated: Now those five directions which are in yonder world,

original: evaitatsamārohaṃstā u evaitadyajamāno dviṣato bhrātṛvyasya vṛṅkte 'tho tā
analyzed: eva etat samārohan tāḥ u eva etat yajamānaḥ dviṣataḥ bhrātṛvyasya vṛṅkte tha u tā
translated: those the gods then won from the Asuras; and verily also by them the sacrificer now wins from his hateful foe; and verily also by them he mounts to them.

analyzed: eva etat samārohati atha u etat vai etābhiḥ devāḥ ā atas  samprāpnuvan tathā eva ābhiḥ ayam etat ā atas samprāpnoti
translated: And by them the gods then reached this world; and in like manner does this (Sacrificer) by them now reach this world.

analyzed: atha enam abhijuhoti
translated: He then makes an oblation on it.

analyzed: etat vai enam devāḥ īyivāṃsam upariṣṭāt annena aprīṇan etayā āhutyā  tathā eva enam ayam etat īyivāṃsam upariṣṭāt annena prīṇāti etayā āhutyā kṛṣṇāyai
translated: The gods then regaled him, after he had come, from above with food, with this libation;

original: śuklavatsāyai payasā rātrirvai kṛṣṇā śuklavatsā tasyā asāvādityo vatsaḥ
analyzed: śukla vatsāyai payasā rātriḥ vai kṛṣṇā śukla vatsā tasyāḥ asau ādityaḥ vatsaḥ
translated: and in like manner this (Sacrificer) now regales him, after he has come, from above with food, with this libation. With the milk of a black cow with a white calf. The black cow with a white calf is the night; her calf is yonder sun.

original: svenaivainametadbhāgena svena rasena prīṇātyupari dhāryamāṇa upari hi sa
analyzed: svena eva enam etat bhāgena svena rasena prīṇāti upari dhāryamāṇaḥ upari hi sa
translated: verily with his own share, with his own sap he delights him. He is carried above; for above is his world.

original: yametatprīṇāti dohanena dohanena hi payaḥ pradīyate / / /
analyzed: yam etat prīṇāti dohanena dohanena hi payaḥ pradīyate
translated: He gratifies him with his own share, with his own sap; while he is being held above (the fire), for above (the earth) is he whom he thus gratifies. With a milking vessel (he gratifies him), for by a milking vessel milk is given.

analyzed: yat u eva enam abhijuhoti
translated: And, again, as to why he offers thereon.

original: śira etadyajñasya yadagniḥ prāṇaḥ payaḥ śīrṣaṃstatprāṇaṃ🔽dadhāti yathā svayamātṛṇāmabhiprakṣaredevamabhijuhuyātprāṇaḥ svayamātṛṇā rasa
analyzed: śiraḥ etat yajñasya yat agniḥ prāṇaḥ payaḥ śīrṣan tat prāṇam  dadhāti yathā svayamātṛṇām abhiprakṣaret evam abhijuhuyāt prāṇaḥ svayamātṛṇāḥ rasa
translated: The fire-altar is the head of the sacrifice, and milk is the breath: he thus puts breath into the head.🔽He should offer (the ghee) thereon in the same way as he would pour it on the naturally-perforated (brick); for the naturally-perforated one is the breath, and this (ghee) is the sap: he thus unites the head with the breath by means of the sap.

original: eṣa śiraśca tatprāṇaṃ ca rasena saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe iti
analyzed: eṣa śiraḥ ca tat prāṇam ca rasena saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti nakta uṣāsā samanasā virūpe iti
translated: 'Night and Dawn, of one mind, of different forms,'--

analyzed: tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ
translated: the meaning of this has been explained.

original: agne sahasrākṣeti /🔽hiraṇyaśakalairvā eṣa sahasrākṣaḥ śatamūrdhanniti yadadaḥ🔽śataśīrṣā rudro 'sṛjyata śataṃ te prāṇāḥ sahasraṃ vyānā iti śataṃ haiva tasya prāṇāḥ
analyzed: agne sahasra akṣa iti  hiraṇya śakalaiḥ vai eṣa sahasra akṣaḥ śata mūrdhan iti yat adaḥ  śata śīrṣā rudraḥ sṛjyata śatam te prāṇāḥ sahasram vyānāḥ iti śatam ha eva tasya prāṇāḥ
translated: 'O Agni, thou of a thousand eyes,'--🔽he is indeed of a thousand eyes, since he is (attended by) pieces of gold. 'Of a hundred heads,'--since Rudra was created with a hundred heads. 'Thy vital airs are a hundred, thy breaths a thousand,'--his vital airs indeed are a hundred,

original: sahasraṃ vyānā yaḥ śataśīrṣā tvaṃ sāhasrasya rāya īśiṣa iti tvaṃ sarvasyai rayyā īśiṣa
analyzed: sahasram vyānā yaḥ śata śīrṣā tvam sāhasrasya rāyaḥ īśiṣe iti tvam sarvasyai rayyai īśiṣa
translated: and his breaths a thousand, who is of a hundred heads. 'Thou art the lord of a thousand treasures,'--thou art the lord of all treasures.

original: ityetattasmai te vidhema vājāya svāhetyeṣa vai vājastametatprīṇāti / / /
analyzed: iti etat tasmai te vidhema vājāya svāhā iti eṣa vai vājaḥ tam etat prīṇāti
translated: 'To him, to that strength we offer this, Hail!' This, doubtless, is strength: it is him he thus gratifies.

analyzed: dvābhyām abhijuhoti

original: śambhūrmayobhūrabhi mā vāhi svāheti śivaḥ syono 'bhi mā vāhītyetat / / /🔽māruto 'si marutāṃ gaṇa iti /🔽antarikṣaloko vai māruto marutāṃ gaṇastadyo
analyzed: śambhūḥ mayobhūḥ abhi mā vāhi svāhā iti śivaḥ syonaḥ bhi mā vāhi iti etat  mārutaḥ si marutām gaṇaḥ iti  antarikṣa lokaḥ vai mārutaḥ marutām gaṇaḥ tat yaḥ
translated: 'Thou art the ocean, the cloud-y,'--for that ocean is the cloud-y;--'the moist giver,'--for it indeed gives the moist (water);--he thus places in this (world) that Vâyu which is in yonder world.🔽'Carry me prosperously and safely, Svâhâ!'--that is, 'carry me in a friendly and kindly manner.'

original: 'ntarikṣaloke vāyustamasminnetaddadhāti śambhūrmayobhūrabhi mā vāhi svāheti🔽śivaḥ syono 'bhi mā vāhītyetat / / /
analyzed: ntarikṣa loke vāyuḥ tam asmin etat dadhāti śambhūḥ mayobhūḥ abhi mā vāhi svāhā iti 🔽śivaḥ syonaḥ bhi mā vāhi iti etat
translated: 'Thou art the Marut (wind), the troop of the Maruts,'--for the Marut (wind) is a troop of the Maruts; he thus places in this (world) that Vâyu which is in the air. 'Carry me prosperously and safely, Svâhâ!'--that is, 'carry me in a friendly and kindly manner.'

original: avasyūrasi duvasvāniti /🔽ayaṃ vai loko 'vasyūrduvasvāṃstadyo 'smiṃloke🔽vāyustamasminnetaddadhāti śambhūrmayobhūrabhi mā vāhi svāheti śivaḥ syono 'bhi
analyzed: avasi ūrasi duvasvān iti  ayam vai lokaḥ vasyūḥ duvasvān tat yaḥ smin loke  vāyuḥ tam asmin etat dadhāti śambhūḥ mayobhūḥ abhi mā vāhi svāhā iti śivaḥ syonaḥ bhi
translated: 'Thou art the blower, the supporter,'--🔽this blower, the supporter, doubtless, is this world;

analyzed: mā vāhi iti etat
translated: and the wind which is in this world he thereby places in this (fire-altar). 'Be thou propitious and friendly to me: bear me up with (thy) self!'--that is, 'be thou auspicious and kindly to me: bear me up with (thy) self!'

analyzed: tribhiḥ juhoti
translated: With three (verses) he offers,--

original: traya ime lokā atho trivṛdagniryāvānagniryāvatyasya mātrā tāvataiva
analyzed: trayaḥ ime lokāḥ atha u trivṛt agniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvatā eva
translated: there are these three worlds, and threefold also is Agni: as great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, by so much he thus places the wind in them.

original: tadeṣu vāyuṃ dadhāti / / /🔽yadveva vātahomānjuhoti /🔽etamevaitadrathaṃ yunaktyedadvai devā etaṃ rathaṃ🔽sarvebhyaḥ kāmebhyo 'yuñjata yuktena samaśnavāmahā iti tena yuktena
analyzed: tat eṣu vāyum dadhāti  yat u eva vātahomān juhoti  etam eva etat ratham yunakti edat vai devāḥ etam ratham  sarvebhyaḥ kāmebhyaḥ yuñjata yuktena samaśnavāmahai iti tena yuktena
translated: And, again, as to why he offers the Vâta-oblations.

original: sarvānkāmāntsamāśnuvata tathaivaitadyajamāna etaṃ rathaṃ sarvebhyaḥ kāmebhyo🔽yuṅkte yuktena samaśnavā iti tena yuktena sarvānkāmāntsamaśnute / / /
analyzed: sarvān kāmān samāśnuvata tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ etam ratham sarvebhyaḥ kāmebhyaḥ  yuṅkte yuktena samaśnavai iti tena yuktena sarvān kāmān samaśnute
translated: The gods then yoked this chariot, thinking, 'By this chariot we will reach all our desires.' By that yoked (chariot) they reached all their desires; and in like manner does the Sacrificer now yoke that chariot for all his desires, thinking, 'By that yoked (chariot) I will reach all my desires.' By that yoked (chariot) he reaches all his desires.

analyzed: vāta homaiḥ yunakti
translated: He yokes it by means of the Vâta-oblations.

analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai vāta homāḥ prāṇaiḥ eva enam etat yunakti tribhiḥ yunakti
translated: The Vâta-oblations are the vital airs: by means of the vital airs he thus yokes it. With three (oblations) he yokes it;

original: trayo vai prāṇāḥ prāṇa udāno vyānastairevainametadyunktyadho 'dho dhuramadho
analyzed: trayaḥ vai prāṇāḥ prāṇaḥ udānaḥ vyānaḥ taiḥ eva enam etat yunkti adhas dhas dhuram adhas
translated: The vital airs are three, expiration, inspiration, and cross-breathing: by means of them he thus yokes him. The yoke-pin is below, the yoke below that,

original: 'dho hi dhuraṃ yogyaṃ yuñjanti hastābhyāṃ hastābhyāṃ hi yogyaṃ yuñjanti
analyzed: dhas hi dhuram yogyam yuñjanti hastābhyām hastābhyām hi yogyam yuñjanti
translated: The vital airs are three, the out-breathing, the up-breathing, and the through-breathing: it is with them he thus yokes him. Below, below, the yoke-pin, below, below, for below, below, they yoke the yoke-pin. With the hands, with the hands, for with the hands they yoke the yoke-pin.

analyzed: viparikrāmam viparikrāmam hi yogyam yuñjanti
translated: Going round, going round, for going round they yoke the yoke-pin.

original: sa dakṣiṇāyugyamevāgre yunakti /🔽atha savyāyugyamatha dakṣiṇāpraṣṭimevaṃ🔽devatretarathā mānuṣe taṃ nābhiyuñjyānnedyuktamabhiyunajānīti vāhanaṃ tu
analyzed: sa dakṣiṇā yugyam eva agre yunakti  atha savyāyugyam atha dakṣiṇāpraṣṭim evam  devatrā itarathā mānuṣe tam na abhiyuñjyāt na id yuktam abhiyunajāni iti vāhanam tu
translated: He first yokes the right-hand horse,

original: dadyādyuktena bhunajā iti tamuparyeva harantyādhvaryorāvasathādupari hyeṣa
analyzed: dadyāt yuktena bhunajai iti tam upari eva haranti ā adhvaryoḥ āvasathāt upari hi eṣa
translated: then the left-hand one, then the right-hand shaft-horse. Thus (it is done) for the gods; in the other way (it is done) for men. He must not yoke it (the cart) again, lest he should yoke what has been yoked. But he may give (the horse) as a present, thinking, 'Let him enjoy who has yoked it.' They carry it (the cart) on (the horse) above, from the Adhvaryu's residence, for above (it is carried).

original: tamadhvaryave dadāti sa hi tena karoti taṃ tu dakṣiṇānāṃ kāle 'nudiśet / / /
analyzed: tam adhvaryave dadāti sa hi tena karoti tam tu dakṣiṇānām kāle nudiśet
translated: He gives it to the Adhvaryu, for he performs with it. But he must point it out at the time of the Dakshinâs.

original: atha ruṅnatīrjuhoti /🔽atraiṣa sarvo 'gniḥ saṃskṛtaḥ sa eṣo 'tra rucamaicattasmindevā
analyzed: atha ruj natīḥ juhoti  atra eṣa sarvaḥ gniḥ saṃskṛtaḥ saḥ eṣaḥ u tra rucam aicat tasmin devā
translated: He then offers the 'shining' (oblations).

analyzed: etābhiḥ ruc natībhiḥ rucam adadhuḥ tathā eva asmin ayam etat dadhāti
translated: Now this whole Agni has been completed here: he has desired the light here. The gods then bestowed the light on him by means of these 'shining' (oblations); and in like manner does this (Sacrificer) now bestow it on him.

analyzed: yat u eva ruj natīḥ juhoti
translated: And, again, as to why he offers the 'shining' (oblations).

analyzed: prajāpateḥ visrastāt ruc udakrāmat tam yatra devāḥ  samaskurvan tat asmin etābhiḥ ruj natībhiḥ
translated: From Pragâpati, when relaxed, pain went forth. When the gods restored him, they restored him with these two painful (rites).

analyzed: rucam adadhuḥ tathā eva asmin ayam etat dadhāti
translated: In like manner does this (Sacrificer) now restore him.

analyzed: yāḥ te agne sūrye rucaḥ
translated: 'Those thy lights, O Agni, in the sun,'--

original: yā vo devāḥ sūrye ruco rucaṃ no dhehi brāhmaṇeṣviti rucaṃ🔽rucamityamṛtatvaṃ vai rugamṛtatvamevāsminnetaddadhāti tisra āhutīrjuhoti
analyzed: yāḥ vaḥ devāḥ sūrye rucaḥ rucam naḥ dhehi brāhmaṇeṣu iti rucam  rucam iti amṛta tvam vai ruc amṛta tvam eva asmin etat dadhāti tisraḥ āhutīḥ juhoti
translated: 'Those lights of yours, O gods, in the sun, bestow a light on the Brâhmans,'--🔽'light,'--for light means immortality: it is immortality he thus bestows upon him. Three oblations he offers;--

analyzed: trivṛt agniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvatā eva asmin etat rucam dadhāti
translated: threefold is Agni: as great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, by so much he thus bestows light upon him.

original: atha vāruṇīṃ juhoti /🔽atraiṣa sarvo 'gniḥ saṃskṛtaḥ sa eṣo 'tra varuṇo devatā tasmā🔽etaddhavirjuhoti tadenaṃ haviṣā devatāṃ karoti yasyai vai devatāyai havirgṛhyate sā
analyzed: atha vāruṇīm juhoti  atra eṣa sarvaḥ gniḥ saṃskṛtaḥ saḥ eṣa u tra varuṇaḥ devatā tasmai  etat haviḥ juhoti tat enam haviṣā devatām karoti yasyai vai devatāyai haviḥ gṛhyate sā
translated: He then offers the Varunic (oblation).

original: devatā na sā yasyai na gṛhyate vāruṇya 'rcā svenaivainametadātmanā svayā devatayā🔽prīṇāti / / /
analyzed: devatā na sā yasyai na gṛhyate vāruṇyā ṛcā svena eva enam etat ātmanā svayā devatayā  prīṇāti
translated: Now this whole Agni has been built up here, and this Varuna is the deity thereof: to him he offers this oblation, and by the oblation he makes him a deity. For, indeed, that (oblation) is a deity to which an oblation is presented, but not that to which it is not presented. With a verse addressed to Varuna (he offers),--with his own self, with his own deity, he thus gratifies him.

analyzed: yat u eva vāruṇīm juhoti
translated: And, again, as to why he offers the Varunic (oblation).

analyzed: prajāpateḥ visrastāt vīryam udakrāmat tam yatra devāḥ
translated: From Pragâpati, when relaxed, the manly power went forth. When the gods restored him,

analyzed: samaskurvan tat asmin etayā vīryam adadhuḥ tathā eva asmin ayam etat dadhāti vāruṇya
translated: with this (verse) they then put strength into it; in like manner does this (Sacrificer) now put it into it. With a verse to Varuna (he puts it in), for Varuna is the king; verily he delights him with his own share;

original: 'rcā kṣatraṃ vai varuṇo vīryaṃ vai kṣatraṃ vīryeṇaivāsminnetadvīryaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: rcā kṣatram vai varuṇaḥ vīryam vai kṣatram vīryeṇa eva asmin etat vīryam dadhāti
translated: with this they bestowed vigour upon it; in the same way he bestows it upon this (sacrificer). With a verse addressed to Varuna (he offers), for Varuna is the ruling power, and the ruling power is vigour; verily with vigour he bestows vigour upon him.

original: taptvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamāna iti /🔽tattvā yāce brahmaṇā vandamāna
analyzed: taptvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānaḥ iti  tat tvā yāce brahmaṇā vandamāna
translated: 'Having praised, I go with the holy power, worshipping', he says;

original: ityetattadāśāste yajamāno havirbhiriti tadayamāśāste yajamāno🔽havirbhirityetadaheḍamāno varuṇeha bodhītyakrudhyanno varuṇeha
analyzed: iti etat tat āśāste yajamānaḥ havirbhiḥ iti tat ayam āśāste yajamānaḥ  havirbhiḥ iti etat aha īḍamānaḥ varuṇa iha bodhi iti akrudhyat naḥ varuṇa iha
translated: 'with the holy power I beseech thee, worshipping', he says; that is, 'the sacrificer, worshipping, desires this of thee';🔽'the sacrificer, worshipping, desires this of thee', he says; 'be not angry here, O Varuna', he says; that is, 'be not wroth here, O Varuna';

original: bodhītyetaduruśaṃsa mā na āyuḥ pramoṣīrityātmanaḥ paridāṃ vadate / / /
analyzed: bodhi iti etat uru śaṃsa mā naḥ āyuḥ pramoṣīḥ iti ātmanaḥ paridām vadate
translated: 'do not deprive us of life, O thou of great wrath', he says; he makes a promise to himself.

analyzed: atha arka aśvamedhayoḥ saṃtatīḥ juhoti
translated: Then he offers the continuations of the Arka and the Asvamedha.

analyzed: ayam vai agniḥ arkaḥ sau ādityaḥ śvamedhaḥ tau
translated: The Arka is this Agni, and the Asvamedha is yonder sun;

analyzed: sṛṣṭau nānā eva āstām tau devau etābhiḥ āhutibhiḥ
translated: they were created separately; the gods by these oblations

analyzed: samatanvan samadudhuḥ tathā eva enau ayam etābhiḥ āhutibhiḥ saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti
translated: united them, made them one; in the same way he by these oblations unites them, makes them one.

analyzed: svarṇa gharmaḥ svāhā iti
translated: 'The golden Gharma, hail!'

analyzed: asau vai ādityaḥ gharmaḥ mum tat ādityam asmin agnau
translated: The Gharma is yonder sun; in that (Agni) he places yonder sun,

analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpayti
translated: He establishes.

analyzed: svarṇa arkaḥ svāhā iti
translated: The golden sun, svāhā.

analyzed: ayam agniḥ arkaḥ imam tat agnim amuṣmin āditye pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: He establishes this fire in that sun yonder.

analyzed: svarṇa śukraḥ svāhā iti
translated: The golden bright one, svāhā.

original: asau vā ādityaḥ śukrastam punaramutra dadhāti / / /
analyzed: asau vai ādityaḥ śukraḥ tam punar amutra dadhāti
translated: That is the bright sun yonder; he places it again yonder.

analyzed: svarṇa jyotiḥ svāhā iti
translated: The golden light, svāhā.

analyzed: ayam agniḥ jyotiḥ tam punar iha dadhāti
translated: This fire is the light; he places it again here.

original: svarṇa sūryaḥ svāheti /🔽asau vā ādityaḥ sūryo 'muṃ tadādityamasya sarvasyottamaṃ
analyzed: svarṇa sūryaḥ svāhā iti  asau vai ādityaḥ sūryaḥ mum tat ādityam asya sarvasya uttamam
translated: The golden sun, svāhā.

analyzed: dadhāti tasmāt eṣaḥ sya sarvasya uttamaḥ
translated: That is the sun yonder; he places that sun yonder as the highest of all this; therefore that is the highest of all this.

analyzed: pañca etāḥ āhutīḥ juhoti  pañca citikaḥ gniḥ pañca ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: He offers these five oblations.

analyzed: gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvatā eva enau etat saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti
translated: The fire has five layers, the year has five seasons, the year is Agni; as great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, with so much he thus joins them, thus he puts them together.

original: yadvevāha / svarṇa gharmaḥ svāhā svarṇārkaḥ svāhetyasyaivaitānyagnernāmāni
analyzed: yat u eva āha svarṇa gharmaḥ svāhā svarṇa arkaḥ svāhā iti asya eva etāni agneḥ nāmāni
translated: And again, why (he offers them). The golden Gharma, svāhā; the golden Arka, svāhā. These are the names of this Agni;

original: tānyetatprīṇāti tāni haviṣā devatāṃ karoti yasyai vai devatāyai havirgṛhyate sā devatā
analyzed: tāni etat prīṇāti tāni haviṣā devatām karoti yasyai vai devatāyai haviḥ gṛhyate sā devatā
translated: he delights them; with the oblation he makes the deity; for that deity to whom the oblation is taken is the deity.

original: na sā yasyai na gṛhyate 'tho etānevaitadagnīnasminnagnau nāmagrāhaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: na sā yasyai na gṛhyate etān eva etat agnīn asmin agnau nāmagrāham dadhāti
translated: That which is not accepted by her, and he thereby places those fires in this fire by name.

analyzed: pañca etāḥ āhutīḥ juhoti
translated: He offers five oblations.

analyzed: pañca citikaḥ gniḥ pañca pañca ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: The fire has five layers, the year has five times five seasons,

analyzed: gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvatā eva enam etat annena prīṇāti
translated: the year is Agni. As great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, with so much he thus delights him with food.

analyzed: atha atas āhutīnām eva āvapanasya
translated: Now then of the pouring out of the oblations.

analyzed: yām kām ca brāhmaṇavatīm āhutim
translated: Whatever oblation he knows to be accompanied by a Brāhmaṇa,

original: vidyāttametasminkāle juhuyātkāmebhyo vā etaṃ rathaṃ yuṅkte tadyāṃ kāṃ cātrāhutiṃ
analyzed: vidyāt tam etasmin kāle juhuyāt kāmebhyaḥ vai etam ratham yuṅkte tat yām kām ca atra āhutim
translated: he should offer it at this time. He yokes this chariot for the desires. Whatever oblation he offers here,

original: juhotyāptāṃ tāṃ satīṃ juhoti / / /🔽tadāhuḥ / na juhuyānnedatirecayānīti sa vai juhuyādeva kāmebhyo vā etā āhutayo
analyzed: juhoti āptām tām satīm juhoti  tat āhuḥ na juhuyāt na id atirecayāni iti sa vai juhuyāt eva kāmebhyaḥ vai etāḥ āhutayaḥ
translated: he offers it when it is complete.

analyzed: hūyante na vai kāmānām atiriktam asti
translated: They say: He should not offer, lest he should overstep. He should indeed offer. For the desires these oblations are offered. There is nothing excessive in the desires.

original: atha pratyetya dhiṣṇyānāṃ kāle dhiṣṇyānnivapati /🔽agnaya ete yaddhiṣṇyā
analyzed: atha pratyetya dhiṣṇyānām kāle dhiṣṇyān nivapati  agnayaḥ ete yat dhiṣṇyā
translated: Then, returning, he pours out the Dhishnyas at the time of the Dhishnyas.

original: agnīnevaitaccinoti tā etā viśaḥ kṣatramayamagniścitaḥ kṣatraṃ ca tadviśaṃ ca
analyzed: agnīn eva etat cinoti tāḥ etāḥ viśaḥ kṣatra mayam agniḥ citaḥ kṣatram ca tat viśam ca
translated: These are the fires, namely the Dhishnyas. He piles up the fires. These people are the Dhishnyas. This fire is the Kshatra. He thus makes the Kshatra and the people.

original: karotyamum pūrvaṃ cinotyathemānkṣatraṃ tatkṛtvā viśaṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: karoti amum pūrvam cinoti atha imān kṣatram tat kṛtvā viśam karoti
translated: He first makes this one, then these others; he makes the Kshatra (nobility) first, and then the Vis (common people).

analyzed: ekaḥ eṣa bhavati
translated: This one is single-layered;

original: ekasthaṃ tatkṣatramekasthāṃ śriyaṃ karoti bahava itare viśi
analyzed: ekastham tat kṣatram ekasthām śriyam karoti bahavaḥ itare viśi
translated: he makes the Kshatra single-layered, and the prosperity single-layered. The others are many-layered;

analyzed: tat bhamānam dadhāti
translated: he bestows upon the Vis the power of the Kshatra.

analyzed: pañca citikaḥ eṣa bhavati
translated: This one has five layers;

original: ekacitikā itare kṣatraṃ tadvīryeṇātyādadhāti kṣatraṃ viśo🔽vīryavattaraṃ karotyūrdhvametaṃ cinoti kṣatraṃ tadūrdhvaṃ citi bhiścinoti tiraśca
analyzed: eka citikāḥ itare kṣatram tat vīryeṇa atyādadhāti kṣatram viśaḥ  vīryavattaram karoti ūrdhvam etam cinoti kṣatram tat ūrdhvam citi bhiḥ cinoti tiras ca
translated: the others have one layer. He makes the Kshatra superior in strength,🔽he makes the Kshatra more powerful than the Vis. He builds this one upwards;🔽he builds the Kshatra on layers above. The others are built crosswise;

analyzed: itarān kṣatrāya tat viśam adhastāt upaniṣādinīm karoti
translated: he makes the Vis subject to the Kshatra below.

original: ubhābhyāṃ yajuṣmatyā ca lokampṛṇayā caitaṃ cinoti /
analyzed: ubhābhyām yajuṣmatyā ca lokampṛṇayā ca etam cinoti
translated: He builds this one with both the Yajus and the Lokampṛṇā bricks;

analyzed: lokampṛṇayā eva imān kṣatram eva tat vīryeṇa atyādadhāti kṣatram viśaḥ vīryavattaram
translated: he makes the Kshatra superior in strength, he makes the Kshatra more powerful than the Vis,

analyzed: karoti viśam kṣatrāt avīryatarām
translated: he makes the Vis less powerful than the Kshatra.

original: sa yadimāṃlokampṛṇayaiva cinoti kṣatraṃ vai lokampṛṇā kṣatraṃ tadviśyattāraṃ
analyzed: sa yat imān lokampṛṇayā eva cinoti kṣatram vai lokampṛṇā kṣatram tat viśyat tāram
translated: If he were to build this one with the Lokampṛṇā bricks alone, the Lokampṛṇā is the Kshatra; he would place the Kshatra as the eater

analyzed: dadhāti ubhayān cinoti adhvarasya ca agneḥ ca adhvarasya pūrvān atha agneḥ tasya uktaḥ
translated: among the Vis. He builds both (kinds of bricks); first those of the sacrifice, then those of Agni. The reason for this has been explained.

analyzed: bandhuḥ yaṃ yam eva adhvara dhiṣṇyam nivapati taṃ tam cinoti āgnīdhrīyam prathamam
translated: Whatever altar-ground he digs out, that he builds up; the Âgnîdhrîya he builds up first, for that he digs out first.

original: cinoti taṃ hi prathamaṃ nivapati dakṣiṇata udaṅṅāsīnastasyokto bandhuḥ / / /
